basics.name: Pedro Fontanarrosa TEST
basics.label: Researcher in Synthetic Biology & Biomedical Engineering
basics.summary: Postdoctoral researcher with extensive experience in synthetic biology, genetic circuit design, and biomedical engineering. Skilled in research, modeling, simulation, and tool development.

work.name: Computational Systems and Synthetic Biology Lab, College University London
work.summary: Developing genetic design automation software, modeling and simulation of genetic regulatory networks, and designing genetic circuits for specific applications under the supervision of Prof. Chris Barnes.
highlights: Development of novel modeling automation techniques

work.name: Genetic Logic Lab, University of Boulder
work.summary: Conducted research in genetic design automation, GRN modeling and simulation, and development of genetic circuits under the supervision of Prof. Chris Myers.
highlights: Simulation and design of genetic regulatory networks

work.name: Evolutionary Studies Laboratory, University of Buenos Aires
work.summary: Performed research in genetics and ecology. Responsibilities included maintaining Drosophila isogenetic lines, coordinating specimen collection and expedition teams, and contributing to scientific papers and technical reports.
highlights: Coordinated field expeditions and permit negotiations

work.name: University of Utah
work.summary: Assisted in teaching Fundamentals of Biomedical Engineering II by leading discussion groups and grading assignments.

work.name: Northlands School
work.summary: Taught chemistry to high school students and coordinated Extended Essays in chemical research.

work.name: Tarbut School
work.summary: Taught primary and high school science and mathematics and organized Mathematical Ingenious Olympiads.

work.name: COMBINE Standards
work.summary: Curated and maintained the Synthetic Biology Open Language standards and related documents, coordinated change proposals, and supported software libraries for the synthetic biology community.

awards.title: Fulbright and Argentine Presidential Fellowship in Science & Technology
awards.awarder: Argentine President’s Cabinet & U.S. Embassy of Buenos Aires
awards.summary: Awarded to pursue a master’s degree in the United States starting Fall 2017.

awards.title: Research and Communication Excellency Award
awards.awarder: Ministry of Science and Technology, Argentinean government
awards.summary: Recognized for excellence in research and communication under the 'Beca Estímulo' scholarship.

awards.title: Beca Estímulo (Encouragement Scholarship)
awards.summary: Supported research and development tasks in genetics and ecology.

publications.name: Evaluating the Contribution of Model Complexity in Predicting Robustness in Synthetic Genetic Circuits
publications.summary: An analysis of how model complexity impacts the robustness of synthetic genetic circuits.

publications.name: Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL) Version 3.1.0
publications.summary: Describes the implementation and features of SBOL version 3.1.0 for standardized data exchange in bioengineering.

certificates.name: Machine Learning A-Z™: AI, Python & R + ChatGPT Bonus [2023]

volunteer.summary: Organized talks, workshops, and DIY projects to promote innovation in science and engineering.
highlights: Manufacturing a PCR thermocycler using Arduino

volunteer.organization: University of Buenos Aires Biology Week
volunteer.summary: Coordinated the annual Biology Week to promote science careers among high school students.

projects.name: Synergistic Discovery and Design (SD2)
projects.description: Genetic circuit design for extreme environments enabled by models extracted from petabyte+ perturbation analyses.
